object.description: Daniel Tigerâ€™s Neighborhood is based on the legacy of Fred Rogers. Its cast are the children of his original and much-loved Neighborhood of Make-Believe characters. A young Daniel Tiger is joined by his friends O the Owl, Katerina Kittycat, Prince Wednesday, and Miss Elaina. Together, through imagination, creativity and music they learn the key social skills necessary for school and for life.
object.title: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood
object.short_description: A young Daniel Tiger learns the key social skills necessary for school and for life.

content.description: Stream All New Episodes of Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood NOW!
content.short_description: Stream All New Episodes of Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood NOW!
content.title: Stream All New Episodes of Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood NOW!

content.description: Jodi teaches Daniel how to play Bean Bag Baskets! She's practiced a lot, and show him how to throw the bean bag into the basket. Then, it's Daniel's turn! Daniel throws, but is disappointed when the bean bag doesn't go in. Mom reminds him that if he keeps trying he might get better. He tries again and gets it closer to the basket!
content.short_description: Daniel keeps trying and gets better at Bean Bag Baskets.
content.title: Daniel Tries a New Game

content.description: A song about how you can keep trying to get better at something. Prince Wednesday tries to cross the playground rings but falls. Later, he tries again and makes it! Daniel tries to hop across the red dots on the path but stumbles.  Later, he tries again and makes it across. Jodi tries to fold a paper box but it falls apart. Later, she tries again and makes the box.
content.short_description: A song about how you can keep trying to get better at something.
content.title: "Keep Trying You'll Get Better" Song

content.description: Brooke is taking a dance class. She and her teacher start off by stretching and warming up, and then begin practicing. Bit by bit, Brooke learns all the steps, and keeps trying to get better and better. When they finally put all the dance moves together, Brooke and her teacher are so happy!
content.short_description: Brooke takes a dance class. She keeps trying to get better.
content.title: Brooke's Dance Class

content.description: Daniel is making a Moon Munchie snack with Grandpere, and he wants to try to make his all by himself. He uses the spreader to try to put peanut butter on his muffin - but it doesn't work because it's so sticky. Daniel learns that when he does something new, he can keep trying to get better. He tries again and it's easier to spread the peanut butter on the muffin!
content.short_description: Daniel is learning how to make a snack with Grandpere and he keeps trying to get better.
content.title: Daniel Makes a Snack

content.description: Daniel imagines that he is on the moon with Grandpere! They bounce and jump around around in space. They even catch stars and float around space with them. After having so much fun, they land back on the moon together!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he is on the moon with Grandpere.
content.title: Daniel Goes to the Moon

content.description: Daniel imagines he's in a jungle bird band! Deep in the jungle, Daniel, Tigey and a group of colorful birds all play instruments. Daniel plays the tambourine, Tigey plays the guitar, one bird plays the trumpet and another plays the banjo! More birds join in, whistling and dancing along to the song.
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's in a jungle bird band.
content.title: Daniel's Jungle Bird Band

content.description: Daniel is excited to read a Tigey the Adventure Tiger book but Amira tells him that they are going to tell an adventure story about Evie the Elephant in the sand instead! Daniel isn't sure about this but he remembers that he might change his mind if he gives it some time. So, he helps Amira draw the story in the sand and they use seashells and seaweed too! Daniel likes the adventure story so much!
content.short_description: Daniel and Amira tell an adventure story in the sand.
content.title: Daniel and Amira Tell a Story

content.description: Janae meets a storyteller and learns about what storytelling means. Then, she and the storyteller make up a story together. Their story is about a fisherman who catches different things while out fishing. Janae has a blast!
content.short_description: Janae meets a storyteller and they tell a story together.
content.title: Janae Meets a Storyteller

content.description: Daniel, Katerina and O are having a sleepover Henrietta serves them applesauce as a sleepover snack before bed - but Daniel says that he tried applesauce before and he didn't like it. He learns that he might change his mind about applesauce if he gives it some time. Daniel tries it again and notices it tastes just like apples. He likes it this time!
content.short_description: Daniel tries applesauce and his changes his mind and likes it now.
content.title: Daniel Tries Applesauce

content.description: A song about how you might change your mind if you give it some time. Daniel is wearing a blue sweater, but he isn't sure if he likes it. He gives it some time and smiles at himself in the mirror. Maragret doesn't want to go in the the pool. She gives it some time and sees Daniel having fun and she changes her mind. Miss Elaina changes her mind about a new food and tries it.
content.short_description: A song about how you might change your mind if you give it some time.
content.title: "You Might Change Your Mind, If You Give it Some Time" Song

content.description: Daniel is worried when Mom Tiger hurts her arm and has to go to hospital. He learns that when he's worried it helps to talk about it. He asks if she is going to be okay, and it helps him to hear that she is. It also helps Daniel to talk about how the people at the hospital are there to help Mom feel better.
content.short_description: When Mom Tiger hurts her arm, it helps Daniel to talk about his feelings.
content.title: Daniel is Worried About Mom

content.description: A song about how when you're worried, it helps to talk about it. Daniel is worried about Mom, and it helps him to talk to his parents. O is worried about a scary shadow, but it helps him to talk to Uncle X. Daniel is worried because Tigey's leg is ripped, but it helps him to talk to his dad who fixes it. Katerina can't find her doll, so she tells her mom who finds it for her.
content.short_description: A song about how when you are worried, it helps to talk about it.
content.title: "When You're Worried, It Helps To Talk About It" Song

content.description: Cam meets an artist and learns what a mosaic is. She gets to see a mosaic that the artist made - and then makes one of her own! She uses glue to stick different colored and patterned paper together to make a mosaic. It looks so beautiful when she is finished!
content.short_description: Cam meets an artist and makes a paper mosaic.
content.title: Cam Makes a Mosaic

content.description: Daniel imagines that Benji is an artist! He goes to Benji's art studio and puts on an apron so they can paint. They paint a picture of Trolley, work on a sculpture of Tigey and show each other their paintings of the Clock Factory. Daniel loves Benji's art studio!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that Benji is an artist with an art studio.
content.title: Benji's Art Studio

content.description: Jodi and Daniel join O and Miss Elaina for craft time at the library. Everyone starts their craft, except for Jodi. She's feeling worried because she lost Benji, and doesn't know if her Mama will be able to find him. She learns that when she is worried it helps to talk about it. After she talks to X, she feels better and starts her craft!
content.short_description: Jodi loses Benji and is worried that her mom might not find him.
content.title: Jodi is Worried About Benji

content.description: Daniel and his friends are at Day Camp! Camp counselor Amira takes them on a nature walk, and leads them in a camp song: this is my happy song, and I could sing it all day long! They find a stick that they all go under in their own way. Katerina twirls under it, Max leans forward and Daniel walks sideways under the stick. They sing their happy song as they continue their hike!
content.short_description: Daniel explores at day camp on a hike.
content.title: Daniel is at Day Camp

content.description: Sing this song when you feel happy! Katerina is happy to see a rainbow while playing outside. Her friends stop to look too, and they feel happy together. O is glad to share his telescope with Katerina, and they both happily look up at the moon. Daniel and Prince Wednesday smile as they make cookies together - andfeel so happy to share them with their friends!
content.short_description: A song about all the things that can make you feel happy!
content.title: "This is My Happy Song"

content.description: Sam is learning how to make a tie dye shirt. First, the shirt has to be wet and spread it out on the table. Then, Sam picks his pattern - he decides to make a swirl! With help from the instructor, he twists the shirt and ties it with rubber bands. Then, Sam picks out blue, green and yellow dye, and squirts it onto the fabric. At the end, the instructor shows him what a finished shirt looks like!
content.short_description: Sam learns how to tie dye a shirt.
content.title: Sam Makes a Tie Dye Shirt

content.description: Daniel, Katerina and Max are making tie dye shirts with different colors and patterns. On the table, there are shirts are tied together with rubber bands, and lots of colors of dye to pick from. Daniel uses red and puts an orange star in the middle of his tied shirt. Katerina puts a heart in the middle of her tied shirt. Max makes a rainbow shirt!
content.short_description: Daniel ties dyes a shirt with different colors.
content.title: Daniel Tie Dyes a Shirt

content.description: Daniel imagines that he can tie dye the clouds with all the colors in the rainbow! Holding a rainbow umbrella, he hops from cloud to cloud turning them all tie-dye. When he's finished, the sky is full of rainbow colors and swirling patterns!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he can tie dye the clouds with all the colors in the rainbow!
content.title: Daniel Tie Dyes the Clouds

content.description: It's Daniel's first time on a train, and he's so excited! Excited enough that he accidently bumps into another passenger. Mom reminds Daniel that, on a train, he needs calm feet and a quiet voice. Daniel gives himself a squeeze and takes a deep breath so he can feel calm and ready to ride the train. He sits down next to the window so he can see everything during the ride!
content.short_description: Daniel is so excited to ride a train for the first time, but learns how to stay calm.
content.title: Daniel Rides the Train

content.description: Mom and Daniel work together to follow the directions to find Juan Carlos' house. First they have to find the flying fish - and Daniel sees them in a fountain in the town square! Then, they have to find the biggest tree - and Daniel spots it, with big purple flowers. Last - they spy the blue front door of Juan Carlos' house. They've arrived!
content.short_description: Daniel and Mom follow directions to find Juan Carlos' house.
content.title: Daniel Goes to Juan Carlos' House

content.description: A song about how much fun it is to make new friends. We see Daniel and Juan Carlos dance, play with toy cars, share toys and slide together! It can be so exciting to play and share with someone new. It's grr-ific to make new friends!
content.short_description: A song about how fun it is to make new friends!
content.title: "I Like to Make New Friends" Song

content.description: Juan Carlos is disappointed because the bakery is closed - he wanted to take Daniel there for conchas (treats). Daniel reminds Juan Carlos that he's happy to be with him no matter what they do! They decide to have bontanas (snacks) at Juan Carlos' house instead. During snacktime, Daniel tries jicama for the first time and he likes it!
content.short_description: Daniel tries a new food during snacktime at Juan Carlos' house.
content.title: Snacktime at Juan Carlos' House

content.description: Daniel imagines he's in a mosaic world with Juan Carlos. They see some mosaics that look different from near and far. Up close they see rocks, shells and beads but far away they can see a whale! Up close they see different colored shapes but far away they can see a big purple tree!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's in a mosaic world with Juan Carlos.
content.title: Mosaic World

content.description: Daniel imagines he's sailing down a river on a floatie with his stuffie friends. They sit on a pineapple floatie, a rainbow floatie and even a unicorn floatie, and sail through a lush jungle until they reach a beautiful waterfall!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's sailing down a river on a floatie with his stuffie friends.
content.title: Sailing on Floaties

content.description: Daniel is at the neighborhood pool! He is so excited to play with his floatie, but lifeguard Prince Tuesday says that floaties aren't allowed in the pool. Daniel is disappointed, but learns that when something seems bad he can turn it around and find something good. He sees Miss Elaina blowing bubbles in the water, and thinks that looks like fun! Daniel and Dad blow bubbles in the pool instead.
content.short_description: Daniel is disappointed that he can't play with his floatie at the pool.
content.title: Daniel Feels Disappointed at the Pool

content.description: Camille meets Captain Ryan and goes on a boat ride! She takes a tour of the boat, and learns how to make the boat go faster and slow down. She even gets to steer! Camille sees all kinds of things, like bridges, the Carnegie Science Center, and even a submarine while on her boat ride.
content.short_description: Camille meets the captain of a boat, and goes on a boat ride.
content.title: Camille Goes on a Boat Ride

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina want to see ducky at the farm, but she isn't there. They feel disappointed, but learn that when something seems bad they can turn it around and find something good. When they see a beautiful butterfly, they decide to look around the farm to look for all of the other good things that could be close by!
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina want to see ducky at the farm, but she isn't there.
content.title: Daniel Doesn't Get to See Ducky

content.description: A song about finding the good things when you're feeling disappointed. When something seems bad, turn it around and find something good!
content.short_description: A song about finding the good things when you're feeling disappointed.
content.title: "Turn it Around and Find Something Good" Song

content.description: Daniel is having so much fun at the pool with Prince Wednesday! They are playing on the splash pad and sliding down the slides when Daniel forgets that there is no running at the pool - and he slips and falls! Prince Tuesday, the lifeguard, makes sure he's okay and reminds him to follow the rules to stay safe at the pool!
content.short_description: When Daniel falls on the splash pad at the pool, Prince Tuesday reminds him of the rules.
content.title: The Splash Pad

content.description: A song about following the rules to stay safe at the pool. Miss Elaina remembers she can't get in the pool without a grown up, so she waits for her dad so she can be safe while she swims. Jodi remembers there's no running at the pool. Katerina and Daniel remember not to play by the edge of the pool. Katerina tells her mom she has to go potty so they can get out of the pool and go.
content.short_description: A song about following the rules to stay safe at the pool.
content.title: "Follow the Rules at the Pool" Song

content.description: The lifeguard at the pool makes sure that all of the kids know the rules at the pool before they get in. Together, the kids remember all the rules at the pool! Now that they've listened, they can go in. The kids swim, laugh and have so much fun! When the lifegaurd blows her whistle, the kids remember to stop, feeze and listen. Then, it's time to get out and dry off!
content.short_description: Kids listen to the rules at the pool before they get in and play.
content.title: Kids Follow the Rules at the Pool

content.description: Daniel imagines he's at a pool noodle party! He's in the pool with lots of colorful pool noodles, and they dance and swim together. It's so much fun!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's at a pool noodle party!
content.title: Daniel's Pool Noodle Party

content.description: Prince Wednesday introduces us to his Pet Rock!
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday introduces us to his Pet Rock!
content.title: Prince Wednesdayâ€™s Pet Rock

content.description: Daniel is so busy playing with his fish that he doesn't listen when Dad Tiger asks him to put his shoes on. Dad reminds Daniel that it's important to stop and show that you're listening. If Daniel doesn't put on his shoes, they can't go to the music shop. Daniel stops playing with the fish and puts his shoes on.
content.short_description: Daniel listens to Dad Tiger and puts his shoes on.
content.title: Daniel Listens to Dad Tiger

content.description: Daniel imagines that he and Dad are racing to the music shop! Side by side, they ride on the backs of two dragons, slide down  twisty slides and row in canoes to the finish line!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he and Dad are racing to the music shop!
content.title: Racing with Dad

content.description: Janae learns all about accordions. Accordian Teacher Ken teaches her about the three parts of an accordion, and shows her how a tuning table works. Janae even gets to play an accordion all by herself!
content.short_description: Janae learns about accordions.
content.title: Learning About an Accordion

content.description: A song about how you can stop and show your friends you are listening. At show and tell, Teacher Harriet reminds everyone to listen as Miss Elaina shows them her stuffie. When Daniel is playing with a toy and not listening to Jodi, he remembers that it's important to stop and listen, and puts down the toy so they can dance together.
content.short_description: A song about how you can stop and show your friends you are listening.
content.title: "I Can Stop and Show You I'm Listening" Song

content.description: Daniel Tiger and his family sing on a snowy ride on Trolley through the neighborhood.
content.short_description: Daniel Tiger and his family sing on a snowy ride on Trolley through the neighborhood.
content.title: Trolley Tunes: I'm Proud of You

content.description: Miss Elaina shows how she plays a backwards game on Backwards Day.
content.short_description: Miss Elaina shows how she plays a backwards game on Backwards Day.
content.title: Miss Elaina's Backwards Game

content.description: Mr. McFeely shares how he sorts the mail at the post office.
content.short_description: Mr. McFeely shares how he sorts the mail at the post office.
content.title: Mr. McFeely's Surprise Delivery

content.description: Jodi sings a song with her Mama sings so she knows how long to brush her teeth!
content.short_description: Jodi sings a song with her Mama sings so she knows how long to brush her teeth!
content.title: Jodi's Tooth-Brushing Song

content.description: Daniel sings a special birthday song to Tigey (and you!)
content.short_description: Daniel sings a special birthday song to Tigey (and you!)
content.title: Happy Birthday from Daniel Tiger!

content.description: Chrissie takes us on a special rock treasure hunt that she set up for Prince Wednesday.
content.short_description: Chrissie takes us on a special rock treasure hunt that she set up for Prince Wednesday.
content.title: Chrissie's Rock Hunt

content.description: Henrietta and Katerina play a flashlight memory game while camping.
content.short_description: Henrietta and Katerina play a flashlight memory game while camping.
content.title: Henrietta's Camping Game

content.description: tbh
content.short_description: tbh
content.title: Teacher Harriet's Puzzle

content.description: Dr. Plat makes colorful play clay with Teddy and Leo.
content.short_description: Dr. Plat makes colorful play clay with Teddy and Leo.
content.title: Dr. Plat's Play Clay

content.description: It's bedtime for Katerina Kittycat! Instead of her mom reading a book to her, she decides to tell her mom a story. Katerina shows her mom a book she made herself about a kitty cat family just like Katerina and her mom!
content.short_description: It's Katerina's bedtime! She reads a bedtime book to her mom.
content.title: Katerina's Bedtime Book

content.description: Miss Elaina leads us to the garden in her front yard. She lifts up a leaf on one of the yellow flowers and reveals...a snail! Miss Elaina pulls her nature notebook out of her backpack and draws the snail's swirly shell and wiggly body - and puts a smile on it's face!
content.short_description: Miss Elaina uses her nature notebook to draw a snail on a flower.
content.title: Miss Elaina's Nature Notebook

content.description: Mom Tiger makes Daniel and Margaret a strawberry-banana ice treat on a hot day.
content.short_description: Mom Tiger makes Daniel and Margaret a strawberry-banana ice treat on a hot day.
content.title: Mom Tiger's Ice Treats

content.description: Amira visits the beach and collects seashells to make a bracelet.
content.short_description: Amira visits the beach and collects seashells to make a bracelet.
content.title: Amira's Seashells

content.description: Join Jodi's Nana as she shows how she sews a quilt out of her grandkids' old t-shirts.
content.short_description: Join Jodi's Nana as she shows how she sews a quilt out of her grandkids' old t-shirts.
content.title: Nana's Quilt

content.description: Lady Elaine is persistant when learning how to make her yo-yo go "around the world".
content.short_description: Lady Elaine is persistant when learning how to make her yo-yo go "around the world".
content.title: Lady Elaine's Yo-Yo Trick

content.description: Max and Amira play bus station together.
content.short_description: Max and Amira play bus station together.
content.title: Max and Amira's Bus Station

content.description: King Friday makes a wind chime out of recycled materials.
content.short_description: King Friday makes a wind chime out of recycled materials.
content.title: King Friday's Recycled Wind Chime

content.description: Queen Sara gives a special look into her morning routine: a song and dance to help Prince Wednesday wake up!
content.short_description: Queen Sara shares her morning routine: a song and dance to help Prince Wednesday wake up!
content.title: Queen Sara's Wake-Up Song

content.description: Grandpere takes us to his cucumber garden and shows how he makes pickles.
content.short_description: Grandpere takes us to his cucumber garden and shows how he makes pickles.
content.title: Grandpere's Garden

content.description: Music Man Stan makes a superhero costume for Miss Elaina.
content.short_description: Music Man Stan makes a superhero costume for Miss Elaina.
content.title: Music Man Stan's Costumes

content.description: X and O share a craft they made to reflect on all of the things they're thankful for.
content.short_description: X and O share a craft they made to reflect on all of the things they're thankful for.
content.title: X and O's Thank You Jar

content.description: Katerina shows us a ladybug lunch treat she makes with her Mom.
content.short_description: Katerina shows us a ladybug lunch treat she makes with her Mom.
content.title: Katerinaâ€™s Ladybug Lunch

content.description: It's naptime at school, but Daniel and Miss Elaina aren't tired! Teacher Harriet reminds them that there are lots of ways that they can rest. "Close your eyes, snuggle, or take a deep breath. You can do what helps you rest!" Miss Elaina cuddles her bunny and snuggles in as Daniel thinks about what helps him rest.
content.short_description: It's naptime at school. Teacher Harriet helps Daniel and Miss Elaina rest.
content.title: Daniel and Miss Elaina Rest

content.description: Daniel and his friends sing about all the things they do to help themselves rest. Daniel takes a deep breath. Margaret cuddles Pandy. Prince Wednesday closes his eyes. Jodi reads a book. Katerina hugs Princess Piggy. Daniel snuggles with Tigey.
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends sing about the things they do to help them rest.
content.title: "You Can Do What Helps You Rest" Song

content.description: We visit with a real-life father-daughter team who handmakes shoes. Mik and Lee pick out the shoe color together, and then Mik shows us how he cuts the leather using a big machine called a click press. Lee hand-paints dragonflies onto the leather, and then Mik glues and sews all of the pieces together. After the laces are put through the holes, we see the final product: a colorful pair of shoes!
content.short_description: A visit with a real-life father-daughter team who handmakes colorful shoes.
content.title: Making Shoes

content.description: We see a classroom of real kids get ready for naptime at school. They take out mats, pillows, and blankets and lay down to nap. Each student finds what helps them rest - they cuddle with stuffies, snuggle into blankets, take deep breaths, or even read quietly with the lights off.
content.short_description: Real kids have naptime at school.
content.title: Naptime at School

content.description: With a little help from his friend Tom, we see real neighbor Iker learn how to build his own kite from a plastic garbage bag and wooden rods. When they're all finished, they take it outside and fly it high up in the sky!
content.short_description: Iker makes and flies his own kite.
content.title: Making a Kite

content.description: It's beach day at school, and Daniel and Prince Wednesday are painting a mural when Prince Wednesday spills a jar of yellow paint. It gets on his pants and all over the floor. Oops! He tries to hide it when Teacher Harriet asks what's wrong. She reminds him that "when accidents happen you should tell someone, and it can help." Prince Wednesday tells her about the spill and she helps him fix it.
content.short_description: When Prince Wednesday spills paint on his pants, he and Daniel wonder what to do.
content.title: Spilled Paint at School

content.description: Miss Elaina and Katerina show Daniel their handmade palm tree. Daniel decides to put some pretend coconuts underneath. He tries to carry too many, and one slips out of his hand, knocks the palm tree over and breaks it. Oh no! What should he do? Daniel remembers what Teacher Harriet said: "when accidents happen you should tell someone, and it can help". Daniel decides to tell Teacher Harriet.
content.short_description: Daniel accidentally knocks over Miss Elaina and Katerina's handmade palm tree.
content.title: Daniel Tells Teacher Harriet

content.description: Music Man Stan finds a special old kite in a box - it was his when he was Miss Elaina and Daniel's age. He lets them fly it. But when Music Man Stan is inside, the wind gets too strong, and the kite falls into the bushes and breaks! Miss Elaina and Daniel don't know what to do. Music Man Stan says that they can tell him anything. When accidents happen, you should tell someone, and it can help!
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina accidentally break Music Man Stan's special kite.
content.title: Daniel and Miss Elaina Break Music Man Stan's Kite

content.description: We see Daniel and his friends telling a grownup when an accident happens. Daniel tells Mom Tiger that he's knocked over a glass of milk, and she helps clean it up. Jodi and Daniel tell Dad Tiger when they accidentally break a toy trolley. Dad Tiger tells Daniel when he knocks over Daniel's block tower by mistake.
content.short_description: A song about telling a grownup when an accident happens.
content.title: "When Accidents Happen" Song

content.description: When Daniel is upset that he can't go to the carnival, Mom and Dad Tiger encourage him to ask questions about what's happening. Daniel wants to know: why can't he go to the carnival? Dad says that that they can't get together with their whole neighborhood right now. They're staying apart so they don't accidentally spread germs. Mom reassures Daniel that grownups are here to keep him safe.
content.short_description: Daniel wonders why he can't go to the neighborhood carnival.
content.title: Daniel Can't Go to the Carnival

content.description: A song about all of the ways that grownups take care of children. Mom Tiger shows Daniel their emergency preparation kit. Henrietta comforts Katerina while it storms outside. O holds Uncle X's hand as they cross the street. Prince Tuesday holds onto Prince Wednesday as he learns to roller skate. Dr. Plat puts a mask on over her nose and mouth. Doctor Anna listens to Baby Margaret's heartbeat.
content.short_description: A song about all of the ways that grownups take care of children.
content.title: Taking Care Sing Along Song

content.description: Daniel, his family and neighbors sing about the things they can do when they miss someone, like drawing a picture, mailing a card, or looking at a photo. They remember that it's okay to feel sad sometimes - little by little, you'll feel better.
content.short_description: Daniel and friends sing about missing someone, and feeling better after they're sad.
content.title: Missing You Sing Along Song

content.description: A song all about families having fun when they spend time together. Daniel and Dad build a sandcastle. Uncle X and O play tic-tac-toe. Jodi, Teddy and Leo play together. Katerina and Henrietta go for a hike. The Platypus family has a picnic in the park. The Tiger family laughs at the dinner table. It doesn't matter what we do, I just like to be with you!
content.short_description: Daniel and his family sing about how they love to spend time with each other.
content.title: Family Time Sing Along Song

content.description: Daniel and his friends are big helpers in their families! One of the ways they are big helpers is by finding something to do when grownups are busy. Daniel helps mom carry a box, and puts away his toys. When mom is busy working at the Enchanted Garden, Daniel colors a picture. Katerina plays tea party by herself. O reads a book. Miss Elaina pretends she's blasting off. Prince Wednesday colors.
content.short_description: A song about all the things kids can do by themselves when grownups are too busy to play.
content.title: When Grownups Are Busy Sing Along Song

content.description: Daniel is so excited for Teacher Harriet to teach him a dance for the Spring Sing that he can't wait to get to school! But when he arrives, Teacher Harriet isn't there. There's a new grownup inside named Mr. Malik - he's the substitute teacher, who is filling in for Teacher Harriet while she's not feeling well. He sings: "things may change and that's okay, today we can do things a different way!"
content.short_description: Daniel meets a different teacher at school.
content.title: Meeting Mr. Malik

content.description: Teacher Harriet is home sick, and the class still doesn't have a dance to go with their Spring Sing song. They need a dance to perform for their parents later that day! Mr. Malik is happy to help. Using each of the kids' signature dance moves, he helps the class come up with a grr-ific dance that they can all do together.
content.short_description: Mr. Malik helps the class come up with a dance for their Spring Sing performance.
content.title: The Spring Sing Dance

content.description: Daniel imagines that he can see the seasons changing from winter to spring! Snow tigers glide by as Daniel watches, bundled in his snow gear. Snow begins to melts from the trees, and leaves bloom on the branches. Birds and and butterflies flutter past as colorful flowers sprout up from the ground.
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he can see the seasons changing right before his eyes.
content.title: Winter is Becoming Spring

content.description: A song all about adapting to change. While Mr. Malik sings, we see Daniel and his friends adjusting as things in their lives change. Daniel tries on a blue sweater. Daniel and Jodi play in the rain instead of at the beach. Katerina tries on tap shoes instead of ballet shoes. Grandpere visits Daniel when Mom and Dad Tiger leave for a bit.
content.short_description: A song all about adapting to change.
content.title: Mr. Malik's "Things May Change and That's Okay" Song

content.description: Saying you're sorry is the first step, then how can I help?
content.short_description: Saying you're sorry is the first step, then how can I help?
content.title: Helpful Tip: Have You Ever Had to Say You're Sorry?

content.description: When you feel so mad, that you want to roar, take a deep breath, and count to four.
content.short_description: When you feel so mad, that you want to roar, take a deep breath, and count to four.
content.title: Helpful Tip: Take a Deep Breath

content.description: Daniel has a song for when you're feeling frustrated.
content.short_description: Daniel has a song for when you're feeling frustrated.
content.title: Helpful Tip: When You're Feeling Frustrated

content.description: Thank you for everything you do!
content.short_description: Thank you for everything you do!
content.title: Helpful Tip: Say Thank You to Everyone You Love

content.description: Daniel imagines that he can make all of the germs on his hands go away.
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he can make all of the germs on his hands go away.
content.title: Germs Germs Go Away

content.description: Daniel and his friends are visiting the crayon factory! They watch as crayons are made, and even get to see the machine that puts together the crayon boxes. Jodi gets a box, and O gets a box, but when it's Daniel's turn, the machine breaks down. That makes Daniel mad! Mom Tiger reminds Daniel that he can take a deep breath and count to four to calm down while Lady Elaine fixes the machine.
content.short_description: Daniel feels mad when he doesn't get a box for his crayons.
content.title: Daniel Feels Mad

content.description: Daniel imagines that he can color his neighborhood with his special new rainbow crayon! He points the crayon at a mailbox and it turns all sorts of colors. He turns the street and houses rainbow-colored too. It's a whole rainbow neighborhood!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he can color his neighborhood with a rainbow crayon!
content.title: Daniel Imagines a Rainbow Neighborhood

content.description: Real kid Benji is playing Dominos with his grandmother. Benji is feeling mad because his dominos keep falling over before he's finished stacking them. His grandmother reminds him what to do when he feels mad - take a deep breath, and count to four. Benji does, lines all of them up, and knocks them all over together. Hooray!
content.short_description: Real kid Benji feels mad while he plays dominos with his grandmother.
content.title: Mad Feelings

content.description: Daniel and O are making an invention! They taped cardboard tubes to a ramp and are trying to get a car to zoom through the tubes. But the car doesn't make it all the way through the tube. That makes them feel mad! They take a deep breath and count to four to calm down. When they're calm, they fix the problem and get the car to zoom all the way though the tube!
content.short_description: Daniel and O feel mad when they can't get their invention to work.
content.title: Daniel and O's Invention

content.description: When things happen that make Daniel and his friends feel mad, they take a deep breath and count to four. Miss Elaina spills paint on Daniel's art by accident. Daniel takes a deep breath and counts to four. Prince Wednesday and Daniel want to go to the beach, but it's raining! They take deep breaths and count to four to calm down.
content.short_description: We see Daniel and his friends calming down when they feel mad.
content.title: "When You Feel So Mad" Song

content.description: Daniel and his family are at the neighborhood market, and then they're going to dinner at the restaurant! Daniel is so excited to go to the restaurant that he's being a little too silly, and knocks over some containers of oatmeal. Mom Tiger reminds him that it's okay to be silly sometimes, but not at the store. She helps him to take a deep breath to calm down.
content.short_description: Daniel is feeling too excited at the neighborhood market and needs to calm down.
content.title: Daniel Calms Down

content.description: Daniel and Jodi are at the neighborhood restaurant. They are so excited to eat tacos for dinner that they can barely sit still! Daniel waves his arms and almost knocks over a tray that waiter Prince Tuesday is carrying. Oops! Dad Tiger reminds Daniel that he needs to be calm when they're at the restaurant. Daniel agrees, and together, he and Jodi take deep breaths to calm down.
content.short_description: Daniel and Jodi are at the neighborhood restaurant, and need to remember to calm down.
content.title: Daniel and Jodi Wait for Tacos

content.description: Real kid Camille visits a guitar factory where she meets people who make guitars. They show her how the guitar backs are cut by a machine, glued, strung, and eventually, played to make music!
content.short_description: Real kid Camille visits a guitar factory where she learns how guitars are made.
content.title: A Visit to the Guitar Factory

content.description: Music Man Stan is visiting school today, and the kids are so excited that he's here! When Music Man Stan leads the kids in a musical game, Miss Elaina is so excited that she keeps playing her instrument when it's not her turn. Music Man Stan reminds her that she can give herself a squeeze, take a deep breath, and let it go. That will help her feel better! When she's calm, they finish the game.
content.short_description: Music Man Stan is visiting school and Miss Elaina is so excited!
content.title: Music Man Stan Visits School

content.description: We see Daniel Tiger and his friends acting silly and jumping around. Katerina and Prince Wednesday run inside. Daniel and Baby Margaret are too silly before bedtime. Jodi and O are silly when a play is starting. When it's time for them to be calm, they give themselves a squeeze, take a deep breath, and let it go.
content.short_description: Daniel Tiger and his friends calm down when they're too excited.
content.title: "Take a Deep Breath" Song

content.description: Miss Elaina, Jodi and Daniel are playing school. Miss Elaina wants to be called Teacher Sneaker - and Jodi says that's her name too! Then Miss Elaina says she likes to blast off backwards - and Jodi says that's her favorite thing. Music Man Stan reminds Jodi that playing with friends who have different ideas makes playing together even more fun. You can do things your own way!
content.short_description: Miss Elaina, Jodi and Daniel are playing school, but Jodi keeps copying Miss Elaina.
content.title: Jodi Learns to Play Her Own Way

content.description: Daniel and his friends are at the Neighborhood Carnival! Daniel plays a game with Miss Elaina. They spin a wheel, and the arrow lands on "do a trick". Miss Elaina does a whacky wheely cartweel! When it's time for Daniel's turn to do a trick, he tries to do a cartwheel like Miss Elaina, but can't. Dad Tiger reminds Daniel that he can do things his own way - and can do his own kind of trick!
content.short_description: Daniel learns that he can do his own kind of trick at the Neighborhood Carnival.
content.title: Daniel Does A Trick

content.description: Daniel and his friends sing about doing things their own way. Daniel and Prince Wednesday build different kinds of block towers. Chrissie chooses to play the drums instead of the tambourine. Daniel does his Tiger Twirl while Miss Elaina does a cartwheel. Miss Elaina, Daniel, and Prince Wednesday play a carnival game where they toss beanbags at bottles in their own way.
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends sing about doing things their own way!
content.title: "You Can Do Things Your Own Way" Song

content.description: Real kid Janae visits a chef and learns how to make her own burrito. She and the chef choose different ingredients for their burritos so that they look and taste different.
content.short_description: Real-kid Janae visits a chef and learns how to make her own burrito.
content.title: Making a Burrito

content.description: Daniel imagines that he's in an underwater race with all kinds of sea creatures! He wears goggles and flippers and lines up at the starting line with a group of fish. They swim together, and Daniel wins the race!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's in an underwater race with all kinds of sea creatures
content.title: Underwater Race

content.description: Daniel is visiting Grandpere! He wants to go for a ride on Grandpere's boat, but the tide is too low. They'll have to wait. Daniel is disappointed, but Grandpere reminds him that they can still have fun in the meantime. They can go look on the beach for hidden sea treasures! Together, they sing "I love the special things I do with you!"
content.short_description: The tide is too low to take a boat ride, so Grandpere and Daniel play on the beach.
content.title: Daniel and Grandpere Go to the Beach

content.description: A song about all of the special things that Daniel and his Grandpere do when they're together. They play ball, gift each other drawings, watch the clouds, and bake together.
content.short_description: A song about the special things that Daniel and Grandpere do when they are together.
content.title: "I love the special things I do with you Grandpere" song

content.description: Real kids and their grandparents spending time together. They play at a playground, go mini golfing, play checkers and go to the park! A little girl who is blind plays on the monkey bars with her granddad. A girl makes a sandwich with her grandma and brings it to her grandfather.
content.short_description: Real kids and their grandparents spend time together in their community.
content.title: Grandparents

content.description: Daniel and Jodi are helping Nana make mozies - a chewy treat with oats and chocolate chips! Nana's grandma taught her to make them when she was a little girl - and now she likes to make them with Jodi. Nana sings "I love the special things I do with you Jodi!" When Nana checks the cabinet for chocolate chips, she realizes they've run out! They'll have to pick something else to go in the mozies.
content.short_description: Daniel and Jodi help Nana make a chewy treat called mozies.
content.title: A Yummy Mozie Treat

content.description: Daniel and Dad Tiger are going camping! They pack up and head to the campground to meet Prince Wednesday, Miss Elaina and their dads. Katerina arrives with her mom and wonders where the other moms are. Does she have to have a dad with her to go camping?
content.short_description: Katerina goes camping with her friends and their dads.
content.title: A Neighborhood Camping Trip

content.description: A song about how families are different, featuring Katerina and her mom Henrietta as they sing about all the special moments they share. They dance and hike, read books and play in the rain - just the two of them. Families are different and that's ok!
content.short_description: A song about how families are different, featuring Katerina and Henrietta.
content.title: "Families Are Different" Song

content.description: Real kid Sam and his family are going camping! They set up their tent in the woods, and unroll their sleeping bags. Then they go to the lake to swim and play frisbee. Along the path back to the campsite, they collect sticks for their campfire. And a the end of the day, they roast hotdogs over a fire and head to bed.
content.short_description: Real kid Sam and his family goes camping.
content.title: Camping

content.description: It's Mom and Me Game Night, and Daniel and Mom Tiger are on their way to the restaurant. Along the way, they spot O and Uncle X and invite them to come along. O wonders if he's allowed at game night: he doesn't have a mom to take him. Uncle X reminds him that "families are different and that's okay". Uncle X will take him to game night - he's a wonderful game player!
content.short_description: O and Uncle X go to game night with O's friends and their moms.
content.title: O and Uncle X Go to Game Night

content.description: A song about how families are different, featuring O and his Uncle X as they sing about all the special moments they share. They read, look at the stars, explore outside, and play games - just the two of them. Families are different and that's ok!
content.short_description: A song about how families are different, featuring O the Owl and Uncle X.
content.title: "Families are Special in their Own Way" Song

content.description: Today, Daniel and Dad Tiger are going to spend the whole day together. Daniel is so excited! He wonders what they'll do - but dad reminds Daniel that "it doesn't matter what we do, I just like to be with you"! Dad plans on taking Daniel to a few places. The first is somewhere sunny, with sand, and lots of seashells...Daniel guesses Jungle Beach!
content.short_description: Daniel is so excited to spend the whole day with Dad Tiger - just the two of them!
content.title: Daniel and Dad Go to The Beach

content.description: Daniel and Dad sing about all the small things that they like to do together. They read a book, build a sandcastle, play catch, pick apples and sit on the couch.
content.short_description: Daniel and Dad sing about the ways that they like to spend time together.
content.title: "It Doesn't Matter What We Do" Song

content.description: Real kid Janae visits a factory where wagons are made! It's loud and dusty inside, so she puts on goggles to protect her eyes and ear plugs to protect her ears. Janae watches as the wood is cut and painted, and how the pieces are all put together to make a wagon.
content.short_description: Janae visits a wagon factory.
content.title: A Visit to the Wagon Factory

content.description: Mom is finally home from work, and she and Daniel are going to play together! "It doesn't matter what we do, I just like to be with you!" Mom sings.  They head outside to play ball. When the ball rolls near Mom Tiger's workspace, Daniel spots an old wagon. Mom says it used to be hers! Daniel asks to fix it up - and together, they do!
content.short_description: Daniel is spending the day with Mom Tiger! They fix up an old wagon together.
content.title: Mom Tiger's Old Wagon

content.description: A sweet montage of Daniel and Mom Tiger spending time together. They they fix Mom's old wagon, adding cardboard sides to the wagon and painting it red and yellow to look like Trolley. Even the pawprint Daniel get's on it by accident makes it special. Based on the original Mister Rogers song "Just for Once".
content.short_description: A sweet montage of Daniel and Mom, based on Mister Rogers' song 'Just for Once'.
content.title: "Just for Now" Song

content.description: Katerina comes over to play with Daniel and Margaret. Katerina wants to play 'family' - but Margaret doesn't want to play with her, and stays close to Daniel. Katerina feels jealous. She wishes Margaret was her little sister. Mom Tiger sings "all families are different, find what makes yours special". Katerina realizes that dancing and twirling is something special her family does together.
content.short_description: Katerina wants to play with Margaret, but Margaret only wants to play with Daniel.
content.title: Katerina Wants to Play with Margaret

content.description: A song about all of the things that make families unique. The Platypus family eats a picnic together. O and his uncle X look at a bug under a magnifying glass. The Tiger Family eats lunch. The neighbors are all different and special in their own ways: some live in a house, others in a tree. Some neighbors have one parent and some have two. Some have siblings and some don't.
content.short_description: A song about all of the things that make families special and unique.
content.title: "Find What Makes Your Family Special" Song

content.description: We visit Alexia at her family's dairy farm. Alexia has a  big family that all work together on the farm - that's something that makes her family special. Alexia and her cousins feed the younger cows. Her older cousins and uncle milk the cows with the help of machines. When they're done working for the day they take a break and have a family picnic.
content.short_description: We visit Alexia at her family's dairy farm.
content.title: A Visit to a Dairy Farm

content.description: The Tiger Family head to the library for Family Day. When they arrive, X the Owl explains the day's activities. X shows Daniel the Neighborhood Family Tree and asks Daniel if he'd like to make a branch for his family. Daniel isn't quite sure what to put on his branch. X tells him to show everyone what makes his family special.
content.short_description: The Tiger Family attend Family Day where Daniel makes a family tree.
content.title: Family Day

content.description: Everyone has finished their family tree branches and it's time to put them on the tree. Daniel is feeling a little nervous - he still isn't sure what makes his family special. Margaret, Mom Tiger and Dad Tiger come over, asking if they can help. That's it! Daniel realizes that's what makes his family special - they're Helper Tigers.
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends talk about what make their families special.
content.title: The Neighborhood Family Tree

content.description: Dad, Daniel, and Margaret go to pick out a birthday cake at Baker Aker's shop. As birthday buddy, Daniel helps by picking a cake that he thinks Margaret would like best. After choosing the cake, Daniel decorates it and helps to take it home for the party.
content.short_description: Daniel helps to pick out Margaret's Birthday cake.
content.title: Birthday Buddy Daniel

content.description: It's Margaret's birthday and her party is just starting! All of Daniel's friends and their families arrive, bringing birthday presents for Margaret. Daniel wants to play with them - but they want to play with the birthday girl. Daniel starts to feel left out. Grandpere arrives, and reminds Daniel that when it's not your birthday, you can be a birthday buddy and help out too.
content.short_description: Daniel feels left out when his friends bring birthday presents for Margaret.
content.title: Margaret's Birthday Party

content.description: A song about what you can do when it's not your birthday - be a birthday buddy! We see Daniel and his friends helping at Margaret's birthday party, They serve cake, help Margaret play a game, make Margaret a card, and even dance! When it's not your birthday what can you do? Be a birthday buddy and help out too!
content.short_description: A song about being a birthday buddy.
content.title: "Be a Birthday Buddy" Song

content.description: Daniel and Margaret get some icy treats from the ice treat cart! Daniel gets a blueberry ice - but is distracted by the other kinds of ice treats. There's a grape ice, and even a rainbow ice! He's so busy looking at all the other treats that he doesn't notice that the ice he's holding is melting all over his paw! Mom reminds Daniel to enjoy the wow that's happening now - the blueberry ice he has.
content.short_description: Daniel orders an ice treat, but it starts to melt as he looks at other ice treat options!
content.title: Daniel's Ice Treat

content.description: Daniel imagines that he's riding trolley through the snow-covered neighborhood, serving icy treats to his friends.
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he's serving ice treats in an icy world!
content.title: Ice Treat Cart

content.description: Daniel and Margaret need a bath to clean up their sticky paws. Mom Tiger even puts bubbles in the bath! Daniel wants his fishy toy - but mom thinks it's at Grandpere's house. Daniel is so busy thinking about getting his toy, that he doesn't realize that all of the bubbles are popping. Mom reminds him to enjoy the wow that's happening now, and Daniel plays with the bubbles while they last.
content.short_description: Daniel wants a bath toy, and is missing all the fun bubbles already in the bath with him!
content.title: Bathtime Bubbles

content.description: Real kid Camille visits a giant room filled with plants, trees, flowers - and butterflies! The butterflies live in the room, flying from leaf to leaf and drinking nectar, which is like syrup made by flowers. Sarah, a scientist, gives Camille a tour, and tells her all about the butterflies. Sarah even shows Camille how caterpillars turn into beautiful, colorful butterflies!
content.short_description: Real kid Camille visits a room with plants and flowers where lots of butterflies fly!
content.title: Butterflies

content.description: Daniel and O are at the library for storytime! Today, Uncle X is going to read a special pop-up book about a caterpillar. Daniel and O are listening to the book and looking at the pictures - until O gets distracted and finds other books he wants to read. X reminds him that they are already reading a book, and that there are lots of things to see on these pages! Enjoy the wow that's happening now!
content.short_description: X is reading a story to Daniel and O, but O keeps bringing over more books to read later.
content.title: The Caterpillar Pop-Up Book

content.description: O and Daniel are reading the pop-up book with X! Daniel is so excited about reading the book that he wants to flip through the pages to see what happens next - but X reminds him that there are still things to look at on this page. Daniel pulls a tab and sees how the caterpillar turns into a chrysalis, and then, a butterfly! Wow!
content.short_description: O and Daniel read the pop-up book with X.
content.title: The Caterpillar's Transformation

content.description: Prince Wednesday joins Daniel and O as they plan to put on a puppet show for Queen Sarah. Prince Wednesday will be the Frog King! But when O and Daniel start the show, Prince Wednesday doesn't have the right puppet out. He's looking at all the other puppets that they could use in more shows! Daniel reminds him that they have a show going on right now - and that they need the Frog King!
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday joins Daniel and O as they put on a puppet show.
content.title: Prince Wednesday and the Frog King

content.description: We see Daniel and his family and friends enjoying the little things in life that make them say "wow!". Daniel and Mom Tiger watch leaves fall. Prince Wednesday and O watch as butterflies flutter past. Miss Elaina draws a duck as a real duck swims near her. Katerina watches a ladybug on a flower. Queen Sarah shows Prince Wednesday a strawberry on a bush. The Tiger family looks up at the moon.
content.short_description: A song showing families enjoying the little things in life.
content.title: "Enjoy the Wow that's Happening Now" Song

content.description: Daniel and Dad are on their way to gymnastics class at the Enchanted Garden! They arrive a little late - and all of Daniel's friends are already doing the activity. The kids jump onto and off a small platform, saying "froggy, star!" Daniel has never done that before. Dad reminds him that with a little help, he can be brave. They hop together to practice - and then Daniel goes up on the stage.
content.short_description: Daniel goes to his first gymnastics class, but isn't sure how to do the new activity.
content.title: Daniel's Gymnastics Class

content.description: Daniel goes up on stage with his friends, and lines up for the activity. When it's his turn at the gymnastic block, Henrietta reminds him that she's right there with him. With a little help, he can be brave! Daniel frog-hops up onto the block and then, after a few breaths, star jumps to the ground! Hooray! For their next activity, Henrietta has the kids crawl like crabs across the floor.
content.short_description: Daniel learns that with a little help, he can be brave - and does the "froggy-star" jump!
content.title: Daniel Feels Brave

content.description: Daniel imagines that he's small enough to ride on the back of a crab on the beach! He rides the crab near the water, through sand tunnels and past oysters with pearls inside of them. They crawl past seashells and even find a treasure chest!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he's riding a crab on a beach!
content.title: Daniel Rides a Crab

content.description: The next activity at gymnastics class is the balance beam! Miss Elaina goes first. She walks on her tiptoes, and, while holding Henrietta's hand, even does a bunny hop! Daniel goes next. He holds onto Henrietta and walks on his tip toes all the way across the beam. Then he lets go of her hand and tries all by himself!
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends try the balance beam at gymnastics class.
content.title: Miss Elaina Tries the Balance Beam

content.description: We see Daniel and his friends being brave with a little help. King Friday helps Prince Wednesday ride his bike. O holds Daniel's hand when he's scared. Dad Tiger gives Daniel a flashlight. Daniel and Miss Elaina cheer O on on the playground. Jodi goes on the ferris wheel with Miss Elaina. Henrietta helps Katerina do a cartwheel.
content.short_description: We see Daniel and his friends being brave with some help.
content.title: "With a Little Help You Can Be Brave" Song

content.description: O and Daniel are at the Dinosaur Playground with mom! It's O's first time, and he wants to try the dinosaur slide - but he didn't know it was so big! He's feeling a little nervous to try it. Mom Tiger reminds O that with a little help, he can be brave. Daniel goes down the slide first to show O how it's done.
content.short_description: O wants to go down the dinosaur slide - but it's so big!
content.title: O's First Time at the Dinosaur Playground

content.description: O is ready to try the slide! He asks Daniel to walk to the top with him - and Mom Tiger stands at the bottom. With their help, O feels brave enough to slide all the way to the bottom! That was so much fun!
content.short_description: With Daniel at the top of the slide and Mom Tiger at the bottom, O feels brave.
content.title: O Feels Brave

content.description: Daniel and O play on the rocking dinosaurs, but Daniel starts to rock too fast. He wants to get off! Mom helps him to slow down, and offers to hold his hand if he wants to try again. O says he'll rock slowly with Daniel too. Daniel tries again - and has a good time!
content.short_description: Daniel and O play on the rocking dinos, but Daniel rocks too fast.
content.title: Daniel Rocks Slowly

content.description: Daniel and O sing about being brave. We see them getting help from grown ups and each other. With help, they do all sorts of brave things, like going down a slide, riding on the dinosaur rocker, and playing on playground equipment.
content.short_description: Daniel and O sing about being brave.
content.title: The Brave Song

content.description: Daniel and Mom Tiger are playing hide and go seek! Daniel hides, and after she counts down to one, mom finds him giggling behind a plant. Daniel says that now it's mom's turn to hide! But mom has to stop playing - it's time for her to go to work. She tells Daniel that she'll be home by dinnertime. Grownups come back!
content.short_description: Daniel wants to keep playing with Mom Tiger, but she has to go to work.
content.title: Mom Tiger Goes to Work

content.description: Jodi and Daniel help Dr. Plat pack a suitcase. She is going on a trip away from home - and she's even flying on an airplane! She will be gone for three whole days. Dr. Plat gives Jodi three 'love you loops' - three paper loops connected together. Jodi will open one loop for each day that Dr. Plat is away - and when Jodi opens the last loop, that's the day Dr. Plat will come home.
content.short_description: Jodi and Daniel help Dr. Plat pack her suitcase for a trip away from home.
content.title: Dr. Plat Packs a Suitcase

content.description: The neighborhood grownups sing about how they are thinking about their families when they are away from home. Mom and Dad Tiger leave home with suitcases - and then come home later! Jodi's mom gets on Trolley - and comes home later to hug all of her kids! A song about grownups going away, and then coming home again.
content.short_description: A song about grownups going away, and then coming home again.
content.title: "Grownups Come Back" Song

content.description: It's dinner time, which means it's time for Jodi to open her first 'love you loop'! She opens it and finds a picture of her cozi-cozi pillow. Maybe that means she should check under her pillow? She finds three sparkley hearts there, left by her mama - one for her, one for Teddy, and one for Leo. Trolley dings outside - that means Daniel's mom is back from work! Grownups do come back!
content.short_description: It's dinner time -  and time for Jodi to open the first 'Love-You' loop!
content.title: Daniel's Mom Comes Back

content.description: Today is the day that Jodi's mama will come home! Nana goes to the market to shop for dinner, and leaves Jodi, Teddy and Leo with Daniel and Mom Tiger so that they can play. But when she leaves, Teddy and Leo start to cry. Jodi and Daniel wonder what will help them. They zoom a tiger striped car across the picnic blanket. It zooms away and then comes back, just like mama will. Teddy and Leo giggle
content.short_description: Nana goes to the market to shop. The kids stay with Daniel and Mom Tiger to play.
content.title: Teddy and Leo Miss Nana

content.description: Mr McFeely arrives - and he has something for the Playtpus kids! It's a postcard from their mama! Mom Tiger reads it for them - she misses them and will be home soon. Teddy and Leo are sad again. They miss their mama! Daniel and Jodi wonder how they can feel better...Daniel knows! They can play '3 little stuffies' where they have the stuffies hop away behind their backs...and then come back!
content.short_description: Mr. McFeely brings the Platypus kids a postcard from their mama!
content.title: A Postcard from Mama

content.description: Nana comes back from the market! Jodi, Teddy and Leo are so excited! Daniel goes back to the Platypus house where he, Jodi, and Nana look at mama's postcard. Nana says that its almost dinner time - which means that it's time for Jodi to open her last 'love you loop'! Inside is a picture of a...door? Jodi opens her front door, and outside is mama! Grownups come back.
content.short_description: Jodi's Nana and Mama come home!
content.title: The Grownups Come Back

content.description: Daniel and Jodi sing about welcoming their grownups when they come back from being away. We see Nana come home to the Platypus kids. X the Owl picks up O from school. Queen Sarah gets Prince Wednesday after his playdate with Miss Elaina. Dad Tiger comes home from a trip. Henrietta gets off of trolley and gives Katerina a hug. Music Man Stan comes home from work and hugs Miss Elaina.
content.short_description: A song about kids welcoming their grownups when they come home.
content.title: "The Welcome Back" Song

content.description: Dr. Anna shows us how to make a lassi - a drink like a smoothie. Dr. Anna's grandmother gave her this recipe. They used to make it together! She mixes in yogurt, milk, sugar, stirring it all with a wooden tool called a madani. Then she adds in ice cubes! Mm, so cool and refreshing!
content.short_description: Dr. Anna makes a lassi - a drink like a smoothie.
content.title: Dr. Anna's Recipe

content.description: Dad Tiger answers the door of the Tiger's house. He takes us over to the models in the foyer - little buildings that he made by hand! He's working on a new one of the Platypus house next door. He stretches out a piece of clay to make a front door, and rolls a little yellow doorknob. Then he fixes both to the door. Done!
content.short_description: Dad Tiger shows us his models.
content.title: Dad Tiger's Models

content.description: Prince Tuesday is in the Enchanted Garden, working on his comic book! It's a story that he's drawing called 'Super Trolley'! He tells us all about Super Trolley's adventures, and shows us the pictures that he's already drawn. Then, he uses some pencils to color in the unfinished pages.
content.short_description: Prince Tuesday draws a comic book in the Enchanted Garden.
content.title: Prince Tuesday's Comic Book

content.description: Dr. Plat isn't just a dentist - she's also an artist! She paints a mural of Tigey the Adventure Tiger holding a big toothbrush. She decides the toothbrush should be pink - but she doesn't have any pink paint! She mixes white and red paint together, and hooray - pink!
content.short_description: Dr. Plat paints a mural of Tigey the Adventure Tiger in her dentist office.
content.title: Dr. Plat's Mural

content.description: O and Katerina are a special kind of neighbor called next door neighbors! That means they live right next to each other. Uncle X built them a rope pulley so that they can pass pictures back and forth between their windows. All they have to do is clip the picture to the rope, and then pull it across to the other side. They draw pictures of each other, living side by side in the treehouse!
content.short_description: O and Katerina pass pictures back and forth between their windows in the tree.
content.title: O and Katerina's Picture Pulley

content.description: Jodi is playing inside a box tunnel in her front yard. Inside the box, she can draw pictures on the walls with her crayons, and even look out a special window to see her little brothers Leo and Teddy playing. Sometimes she likes to play with them, but other times she wants to play by herself.
content.short_description: Jodi plays inside the box tunnel in her yard.
content.title: Jodi's Box Tunnel

content.description: Leo, Teddy and their big sister Jodi Platypus play pat-a-cake while their Nana bakes a real cake in the kitchen! They sing the song, doing patting and rolling hand motions - and then Nana's cake is ready. Yum!
content.short_description: Leo, Teddy and their big sister Jodi Platypus play pat-a-cake.
content.title: Leo and Teddy's Pat-a-Cake Song

content.description: Mom Tiger is headed to the park! One of the swings is broken, and she's going to fix it! Mom takes off the old wooden swing seat and drills holes through a new one. Then she ties the rope back through the swing to fasten it on. Good as new! Daniel, O, and Dad arrive and Daniel tries out the new swing. Grr-ific!
content.short_description: Mom Tiger fixes a swing at the playground with her carpenter tools.
content.title: Mom Tiger's Swingset

content.description: It's nighttime, and O the Owl is in his pajamas! He leads us through his bedroom and over to his window, where a long green telescope points up at the night sky. O explains that the telescope helps him to see really, really far away - all the way up to space! We can even see the craters and mountains on the moon up close.
content.short_description: O looks at the night sky through his telescope.
content.title: O the Owl's Telescope

content.description: Daniel is looking around the house for something he can use as a drumstick. He sees a spoon that Margaret is playing with - it's perfect! Daniel takes it from her, and she begins to cry. Dad reminds Daniel that Margaret was using it first. Before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay! Daniel asks, but Margaret says no. Dad tells Daniel that he can use a whisk as a drumstick instead.
content.short_description: Daniel looks for his missing drumstick.
content.title: Daniel's Drum

content.description: It's snacktime at the Platypus house! Jodi ate all of her carrots, but is still hungry! She sees that Teddy hasn't eaten one of his carrots- so she takes it from his plate. Teddy starts to cry! He doesn't like that Jodi took it without asking. Nana reminds Jodi that before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. Jodi asks, but Teddy says no. Nana gives Jodi one of her carrots instead.
content.short_description: When Teddy isn't looking, Jodi takes one of his carrots.
content.title: Jodi Takes a Carrot

content.description: Leo wants to play with Jodi's special stuffie Benji, but doesn't ask before taking him. Nana reminds Jodi that Leo is too little to know how to ask before taking things. Daniel comes up with an idea - what if Leo and Teddy hold Benji while they watch Daniel and Jodi put on a show!
content.short_description: Leo wants to play with Jodi's special stuffie, but doesn't ask before taking him.
content.title: Leo Wants to Play with Benji

content.description: A song about friends and family asking first before they take things from others.  We see Daniel asking Margaret to play with a toy trolley, Leo asking to use Jodi's blue paint, Daniel offering a tambourine to Margaret instead of his drum, Jodi asking Daniel to read his book, and Teddy and Leo sharing a magnifying glass.
content.short_description: A song about friends and family asking first.
content.title: 'Before You Take Something Away' Song

content.description: Sweater Kid Sam visits with a percussionist who shows him how to use a xylophone, a shekere and the timpani.
content.short_description: Sweater Kid Sam visits with a percussionist.
content.title: A Visit with a Percussionist

content.description: O the Owl is reading a book to the class, but Prince Wednesday wants to see the pictures close up - so close, that he takes the book from O's hands. Now O can't read the rest of the story, and the class can't see! Teacher Harriet reminds Prince Wednesday that before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. Prince Wednesday returns the book, and O says that he can look after storytime.
content.short_description: O the Owl is reading a book to the class, but Prince Wednesday wants to see it up close.
content.title: Prince Wednesday Learns to Ask First

content.description: Daniel takes some of Miss Elaina's blocks to build a piggy house with O. She's upset. She was using them first! Teacher Harriet reminds Daniel that even though he wants the blocks too, before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. When Daniel does ask, Miss Elaina won't let him take the blocks to build his house - but maybe he can find something else to use!
content.short_description: Daniel takes some of Miss Elaina's blocks without asking.
content.title: Daniel Takes Without Asking

content.description: Daniel, O the Owl and Katerina are playing piggies! Katerina asks to borrow the piggy nose that Tigey is wearing before she takes it. Daniel gives her his piggy ears instead, and then dresses up as a baby wolf! O makes pretend spaghetti sandwiches for everyone - including Tigey, who remembers to ask first before taking more spaghetti.
content.short_description: Daniel, O the Owl and Katerina show that they know how to ask first.
content.title: Piggy Pretending

content.description: Daniel and Dad built an obstacle course in their living room! Daniel wants Margaret to play with him. They are having lots of fun until Daniel starts to rush Margaret through the course - he's moving too fast and Margaret falls. Dad reminds Daniel that sometimes you need to play in a gentle way.
content.short_description: Daniel and Margaret wear PJs and play on an obstacle course in their living room
content.title: Daniel Plays Rough with Margaret

content.description: Daniel imagines that he and Margaret are playing in an obstacle course in the clouds! They bounce through the clouds, row in a cloud-boat, and do the backstroke through the sky!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he and Margaret are playing in the clouds.
content.title: Daniel Plays in the Clouds: Imagination Moment

content.description: Daniel is playing too loudly on the obstacle course. Margaret covers her ears, and Daniel reminds himself that he needs to play gently (and quietly) with Margaret. Margaret finds Daniel's toy trolley and Tigey. She throws Tigey to the ground and bangs trolley on the floor, upsetting Daniel. Dad reminds Daniel that Margaret is little, and needs help being gentle. Together, they show her how.
content.short_description: Margaret plays too roughly with Tigey and a toy trolley.
content.title: Margaret Learns to be Gentle

content.description: Daniel is pretending to be a slow turtle, and Katerina wants to be a wiggly octopus! She holds Daniel and Prince Wednesday's hands and moves her arms fast back and forth. Daniel doesn't like this - his friends are being too rough and loud! Teacher Harriet reminds Katerina and Prince Wednesday that sometimes you need to play in a gentle way. Today, Daniel is being a slow turtle, and that's ok.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to pretend to be a slow turtle, but his friends are playing too fast.
content.title: Daniel Pretends to be a Turtle

content.description: It's time to do classroom jobs, and Daniel and Miss Elaina are in charge of feeding Snowball. They get some lettuce and wave it in front of Snowball, speaking loudly. They wonder why Snowball won't eat. Teacher Harriet sees this, and encourages them to speak softly to Snowball so that he won't be afraid. Soon, he's happily eating out of their hands.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina learn how to feed Snowball gently.
content.title: Being Gentle with Snowball

content.description: Daniel and his friends sing about playing gently. O pets snowball softly. Miss Elaina makes an art project. Some of the friends make a blocktower too quickly, and it falls over. They rebuild it carefully and it stays standing. Katerina runs toward some birds, and they fly away. She approches slowly, and they stay still as she watches them.
content.short_description: A song about gentle activities.
content.title: 'Sometimes You Need to Play in a Gentle Way' Song

content.description: Daniel is getting ready to go to the dentist for the first time! Mom and Daniel sing a song about brushing teeth. When they get on Trolley, Daniel is a little nervous. Mom reminds him that 'when we do something new, let's talk about what we'll do'! She tells Daniel that Dr. Plat is going to look in his mouth to make sure his teeth are healthy. He'll need to open his mouth and do a quiet roar.
content.short_description: Daniel gets ready to go to the dentist for the first time.
content.title: Daniel Does a Quiet Roar

content.description: Daniel arrives at the dentist with his mom. Dr Plat gives him some toy tools that he can use to pretend to clean the teeth of a stuffed dinosaur. When she takes him back to the exam room, Dr. Plat explains what she's going to do - from brushing Daniel's teeth, to looking inside with a little mirror, to using a special spinning toothbrush that cleans the plaque off teeth.
content.short_description: Daniel arrives at the dentist. Dr. Plat explains how she is going to clean his teeth.
content.title: Daniel Gets His Teeth Cleaned

content.description: Dr Platt sings about all the things dentists do to help make sure you have a healthy mouth.
content.short_description: A song about how dentists are there to help make sure you have a healthy mouth.
content.title: Dentists Are There to Help Song

content.description: A real kid named Sam goes to the dentist.
content.short_description: A real kid named Sam goes to the dentist.
content.title: Dentist Interstitial

content.description: Daniel notices that his hair has grown really long! Dad tells him that he needs a haircut. Dad shows Daniel what cutting hair is like on a funny face that Daniel made. He tells Daniel that Nana Platypus next door can cut his hair - she's a hairdresser! Inside the Playtpus house, Prince Tuesday is getting his hair cut. He reassures Daniel that it doesn't hurt!
content.short_description: Daniel notices that his hair has grown really long!
content.title: Daniel's Long Hair

content.description: Daniel isn't ready to get his hair cut yet! He watches as Nana brushes Miss Elaina's hair into sections, puts colorful bobbles into her hair, and braids the strands with two hands. Daniel imagines that he's in a hairsalon with barber shop quartet-singing hair tools! When he's done imagining, Daniel sees that Miss Elaina's braids are done - she loves her hair!
content.short_description: Daniel isn't ready for his haircut yet, so he watches as Nana braids Miss Elaina's hair.
content.title: Miss Elaina Gets her Hair Braided

content.description: Daniel is finally ready to get his first haircut! Nana reminds Daniel that she'll tell him everything she does before she does it. She raises his chair up high, then puts a cape on him. Nana sprays his hair with water so it's easier to cut. Then she combs and cuts. Daniel thinks about his friends taking care of their hair. Back in the barbershop, Daniel looks in the mirror - he loves his haircut!
content.short_description: Daniel is finally ready to get his hair cut!
content.title: Nana Cuts Daniel's Hair

content.description: Music Man Stan makes bowling pins out of empty bottles and rice - but tells us that we can make them from anything we have at home. He uses a ball and knocks some of the pins down! Miss Elaina arrives and take a turn of her own. She knocks three pins over! Music Man Stan and Miss Elaina love to play games together.
content.short_description: Music Man Stan plays a homemade bowling game.
content.title: Music Man Stan's Bowling Game

content.description: Daniel has made a Tigertastic car! He wants to race with Prince Wednesday, but Prince Wednesday is playing with Jodi. Daniel is upset that Prince Wednesday doesn't want to play with him. He wonders if they are still friends. Teacher Hariett reminds Daniel that even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday plays with Jodi instead of Daniel.
content.title: Prince Wednesday is Still Daniel's Friend

content.description: Daniel and Jodi are playing moving! O comes over and asks Daniel if he wants to read a book about trains. Daniel says no - he's playing with Jodi. O doesn't understand. Daniel likes trains, and his book is about trains. Is Daniel not his friend anymore? Daniel tells O that they are still friends - even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: O wants to read a book with Daniel, but Daniel is playing with Jodi.
content.title: O Wants to Read with Daniel

content.description: We see Daniel and his friends playing in different groups. Jodi and Prince Wednesday don't want to play racecar with Daniel. Daniel plays alone until they join him. Miss Elaina and Daniel play checkers. Jodi wants them to play with her and her stuffed animal. They say no thank you. Even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: A song about friends playing with new people.
content.title: 'Even When Friends Play with Someone New' Song

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are playing splat ball. When Jodi arrives, they offer to teach her to play. The three of them are having so much fun!
